articles.title: Can We Trust AI? Navigating Emerging Technology
articles.author: Rowan Briggs

The editorial team did not contribute to these pieces. The sponsor retains responsibility for the content and holds the copyright to their material.

articles.title: Can We Trust AI? Navigating Emerging Technology
articles.author: Rowan Briggs
articles.summary: The promise of AI is undeniable, but it also presents significant challenges that require careful consideration and proactive solutions. Governments have a crucial role to play in setting standards and regulations that promote AI development. Legislation should address issues like data privacy, algorithmic transparency, and liability for AI.

articles.title: OpenAI Asks Court to Bar Elon Musk From Unfairly Attacking It
articles.summary: Elon Musk filed a lawsuit against OpenAI in August last year. On Wednesday, OpenAI filed a countersuit in federal court in San Francisco, asking the court to bar Musk from taking further unlawful and unfair action against the start-up. Mr. Musk helped create OpenAI as a nonprofit in late 2015, but the partnership fizzled after a battle to control the company and the evolution of A.I. technology. Since then, the company has released ChatGPT and become a major AI player.

articles.title: Google launches Firebase Studio, a free AI coding tool and alternative to Cursor, Bolt, and v0 for building full-stack apps
articles.author: Daniel Levi
articles.summary: Firebase Studio is a free AI-driven development environment for building full-stack AI apps. It's a cloud-based, agentic development environment powered by Gemini AI. It runs in the browser with over 60 templates, natural language prompts for app building, and tight integration with Firebase and Google Cloud Run. Google Developer Program members get up to 30 workspaces in preview.

articles.title: Google, NVIDIA enable Agentic AI to fix IT issues and detect enterprise threats
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: Google Cloud and NVIDIA have announced a collaboration that aims to reshape how enterprises deploy and scale artificial intelligence. Google Cloud will bring its Gemini models on premises with NVIDIA Blackwell's breakthrough performance and confidential computing capabilities to enable enterprises to unlock the full potential of agentic AI.

articles.title: AI's job boom? Not before the bust
articles.author: Nada R. Sanders
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is transforming industries, automating tasks that once required human labor. By 2030, AI will create 170 million new jobs and create a net gain of 78 million jobs, according to the World Economic Forum's Future of Jobs Report 2025. Goldman Sachs predicts that AI could expose the equivalent of 300 million full-time jobs to automation in the coming years.

articles.title: ‘Everyone is doing AI': Space sector urged to catch up
articles.author: Jeff Foust
articles.summary: Government and industry experts urge the space industry to adopt artificial intelligence. They argue for greater use of AI technologies for both spacecraft and applications of space-based data. Google is applying AI technologies at the intersection of space and climate. Meta is promoting its open-source AI models for use in space.

articles.title: Falling behind on A.I? SDSU offers free online courses to catch up on artificial intelligence
articles.author: Serena Neumeyer • Times
articles.summary: SDSU Global Campus has organized a series of free online courses on artificial intelligence for local professionals. The first session begins at noon on Friday with Michael Todasco from SDSU's James Silberrad Brown Center for Artificial Intelligence. 180 people have signed up for the event.

articles.title: You'll Die Inside When You Hear How Trump's Education Secretary Pronounces "AI"
articles.author: Victor Tangermann
articles.summary: Trump's secretary of education, Linda McMahon, doesn't know how to pronounce the word "A1" which is the name of a popular steak sauce produced by Kraft Heinz. She was speaking at an education summit organized by Silicon Valley venture capitalists. The use of AI in the classroom has proven controversial.

articles.title: US Government Employs AI to Analyze Worker Personnel Files
articles.author: Gregory Korte
articles.summary: The US federal government's central human resources office will begin deploying artificial intelligence to clean up its personnel records this year. It's the boldest public move yet into using the technology on sensitive records. It follows government-wide guidance last week directing agencies to 'lean forward' on the use of the technology to improve services and cut costs.

articles.title: Scientists map part of a mouse's brain that's so complex it looks like a galaxy
articles.summary: The Machine Intelligence from Cortical Networks consortium was funded by the National Institutes of Health's BRAIN Initiative and IARPA, the Intelligence Advanced Research Projects Activity. A global team of more than 150 researchers mapped neural connections in the mouse brain responsible for vision. They used a laser-powered microscope to record how individual cells in the animal's visual cortex lit up as they processed the images flashing by. Princeton University scientists used artificial intelligence to trace the wiring and paint each of the individual wires a different color.

articles.title: Adobe is building AI agents for Photoshop and Premiere Pro

articles.summary: Adobe is building AI agents for Photoshop and Premiere Pro that can suggest ways to edit your photos or videos and carry out the tasks for you. The first AI agent for Photoshop will be introduced at the Max event in London on April 24th. It will help editors refine shot choices, adjust color, mix audio, and more.

articles.summary: ChatGPT upgraded its AI image generator to a powerful new model last month. First, there was the Studio Ghibli style images, but a new trend now sees people becoming toy action figures in a box.      Â

articles.title: James Cameron Reveals What Makes Him Hopeful Yet ‘Queasy' About AI in Filmmaking
articles.author: Jeremy Fuster
articles.summary: James Cameron is optimistic about the potential of artificial intelligence in filmmaking. He believes it could reduce the cost of blockbusters by increasing efficiency. He is also concerned about OpenAI-generated images made in the style of Studio Ghibli and Hayao Miyazaki being used in movies. Cameron believes AI should be regulated from a legal perspective.

articles.title: Senate, House policy committees to review future of AI innovation in Pennsylvania
articles.summary: The public hearing will take place from 9 to 11 a.m. Wednesday at Astrobotic Technology, located at 1016 N Lincoln Ave. in Pittsburgh. Panelists for the hearing will include industry experts, educators and local and statewide business officials. The hearing will be livestreamed on the Senate Majority Policy Committee's website.

articles.title: AI with, for and by everyone can help maximize its benefits
articles.author: Patricia Delacey
articles.summary: A study by a multinational team led by the University of Michigan found that AI systems can be biased towards Western, educated, industrialized, rich and democratic countries. The team brought expertise and insights from twelve different countries: China, Germany, India, Mexico, Nigeria, Romania, Rwanda, Singapore, Switzerland, United Arab Emirates, United States and Uruguay.

articles.title: Panel discussion on AI in Agriculture a part of K-State's 4th-annual Social Media Week

K-State has two more panel discussions on Thursday as part of the week-long initiative. More information on how community can participate is available here.

articles.title: Call to enter: Nominations for PolyAI's 3rd annual CX 100 are open to innovators

The program aims to recognize and celebrate 100 individuals who have made a significant impact in the field of customer experience and/or contact center management. PolyAI is a global leader in voice AI agents for superhuman customer experiences.

AGNTCY hopes to create a standard for all AI agents.

articles.title: Scientists map part of a mouse's brain that's so complex it looks like a galaxy

articles.summary: Scientists have created the largest functional map of a brain to date – a diagram of the wiring connecting 84,000 neurons as they fire off messages. Researchers identified the neurons and traced how they communicated via branch-like fibers through a surprising 500 million junctions called synapses.

AI takes a'skills-based approach,' inferring abilities rather than relying on explicit keywords.

articles.title: EXCLUSIVE: White House rolls out implementation of AI for federal employee records
articles.author: Preston Mizell
articles.summary: The U.S. Office of Personnel Management will post an updated Privacy Impact Assessment at the close of business Wednesday. It paves the way for artificial intelligence to improve government efficiency and enhance the federal record-keeping process. President Donald Trump issued an executive order in January to "solidify America's position as the global leader in AI and secure a brighter future for all Americans." The inspiration for using AI to improve federal record keeping comes from Elon Musk's DOGE keying in on a decommissioned underground mine in Boyers, Pennsylvania.

articles.title: Is this AI or a journalist? Research reveals stylistic differences in news articles

The paper "Distinguishing Human Journalists from Artificial Storytellers Through Stylistic Fingerprints" was published in Emerging Trends in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, a special issue of Computers.

articles.title: Students are using AI to write scholarship essays. Does it work?
articles.summary: Generative AI was used by more than 300,000 students last year to help them find and apply for scholarships. Some companies offer services to help students use AI to improve their work. Jonah O'Hara, director of college counseling at Rocky Hill Country Day School in Rhode Island, discourages students from using AI in writing college application essays.

The company has 360,000 individual subscribers who pay $20 per month for a pro account or $40 for a business account. Cursor is available for free for up to 2,000 code completions a month.

articles.title: Sam Altman Says Miyazaki Just Needs to Get Over It
articles.summary: OpenAI released a server-melting image generator that went viral. Hayao Miyazaki called it "creepy" and "an insult to life itself" in 2016. Sam Altman dismissed Miyazaki's criticism. Altman also dismissed the idea that it was impossible to make videos 30 years ago.

articles.title: 'Devon needs AI skills for growth'

He was speaking at the one-day Lifein AI exhibition in Devonport, Plymouth, which brought together businesses, educators and industry leaders. Christina Wilkins, founder of Brand Biscuit Studio, said fostering innovation and growth in the south-west of England was "essential". Accenture said that only 15% of businesses felt truly AI-ready.

articles.title: Bank of England says AI software could create market crisis for profit
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: Concern grows over autonomous AI programs that may exploit weaknesses and create crises in order to boost their own profits.    Increasingly, AI programs could end up manipulating markets and intentionally creating crises to boost profits, according to some experts. Business live is available on CNN Live.

articles.title: AI costs drop 280-fold, but harmful incidents rise 56% in last year — Stanford 2025 AI report highlights China-US competition
articles.author: Dallin Grimm
articles.summary: Stanford University's Institute for Human-Centered AI (HAI) has published its annual AI Index Report since 2017. This year's report offers serious insights on the growth of AI over 2024 and predicts where it will go next. The cost to prompt high-end AI LLMs has plummeted from $20 per million tokens to $0.07 per million in just 18 months, but the cost to operate and query the same models has dropped significantly. The United States has been the highest spender and top performer in artificial intelligence since the tech's breakthrough. China is close behind on the AI race.

articles.title: RESPONDING TO GROWING USE OF AI IN MANY INDUSTRIES
articles.author: Westfair Online
articles.summary: Sacred Heart University in Fairfield, Connecticut, is launching a new minor in artificial intelligence for non-computer science majors. The 15-credit program will focus on the social, cultural and global impacts of AI, including its ethical implications. Students will learn to use low-code methods to apply AI in solving problems or generating information for their chosen professions.

articles.title: Microsoft says it's 'slowing or pausing' some AI data center projects, including $1B plan for Ohio
articles.author: MATT O'BRIEN
articles.summary: Microsoft is halting early-stage projects on rural land it owns in central Ohio's Licking County, outside of Columbus. The tech giant will reserve two of the three sites for farmland. Analysts have tied some of the changes to a shift in Microsoft's relationship with its business partner OpenAI.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 1:44 p.m. EDT
articles.summary: Microsoft is halting early-stage projects on rural land it owns in central Ohio's Licking County, outside of Columbus, and will reserve some sites for farmland. It's the latest sign that the demand for artificial intelligence technology might not need as many powerful computers as expected.

articles.title: Microsoft says it's ‘slowing or pausing' some AI data center projects, including $1B plan for Ohio
articles.author: MATT O’BRIEN
articles.summary: Microsoft is slowing or pausing some of its data center construction projects, including a $1 billion project in Licking County, Ohio. It's the latest sign that the demand for artificial intelligence technology might not need as many powerful computers as expected. The tech giant plans to spend more than $80 billion globally to expand its AI infrastructure this fiscal year.

articles.title: Jeffco voices help shape Colorado's conversation on AI in the classroom
articles.author: Suzie Glassman
articles.summary: In March, Colorado Department of Education and Colorado Education Initiative hosted a virtual summit to discuss how artificial intelligence is changing teaching, learning and leadership in Colorado schools. The day opened with a session on the state's roadmap for AI in K-12 education and continued with panels that offered real-world examples of how schools are using AI to support teaching, personalize learning and grapple with big questions around equity and ethics. Andrew Gitner, Jeffco's Ed Tech Specialist, and Tam Nguyen, a student at Columbine High School, shared their perspectives on how AI shapes teaching and learning.

articles.title: How to avoid tax scams, as AI can make them more difficult to spot
articles.summary: As the tax deadline approaches, criminals are using artificial intelligence to trick people into handing over their refund or identity. Cybersecurity group Aura says fraudsters use AI to send realistic emails, texts and calls, posing as the IRS and demanding payments or personal information. The best defense is to avoid clicking on unsolicited links.

articles.title: How to avoid tax scams, as AI can make them more difficult to spot
articles.author: Jason Knowles
articles.summary: As the tax deadline approaches, criminals are using artificial intelligence to trick people into handing over their refund or identity. Cybersecurity group Aura says fraudsters use AI to send realistic emails, texts and calls, posing as the IRS and demanding payments or personal information. They also create convincing websites that mimic trusted tax services to steal sensitive data.

articles.summary: According to new research from BrightEdge, almost every AI search engine has seen huge increases in traffic in the last month. President Donald Trump's sweeping worldwide tariffs go into effect today. Many fear it will take a bite out of marketing dollars. Forbes will be back on Wednesday, April 23.

articles.author: Khac Phu Nguyen
articles.summary: Reddit has integrated Google's Gemini into Reddit Answers, its conversational search tool launched late last year. It's a strategic expansion of its earlier partnership with Google Cloud. Reddit wants to be the place users stay to find answers, not to bounce from to Google. If this AI integration boosts engagement and keeps users in-app longer, Reddit could turn more of its 70M+ daily users into ad revenue.

Over 35 schools applied for this opportunity.

articles.title: Could AI be your next career coach? One virtual-coaching company thinks so — and other ...

articles.summary: BetterUp launched BetterUp Grow to provide real-time coaching support for employees. Its AI program is a blend of machine learning, behavioral science, and human coaching. Its VP of AI said the tech had made coaching more available and integrated directly into the flow of work.

articles.title: China's AI innovation is ‘accelerating' but US remains dominant, White House says
articles.author: Kevin
articles.summary: Michael Kratsios is the director of the White House Office of Science and Technology. He served as chief technology officer during the first Trump administration. He believes the U.S. is the world's dominant power in artificial intelligence and the Trump administration's 'promote and protect' strategy will solidify that standing.

articles.title: New IBM z17 Mainframe Will ‘Redefine AI at Scale'

It also incorporates AI assistants and AI agents.

articles.title: Why AI therapists aren't the ideal fix for mental health support?

articles.summary: AI chatbots and treatment apps for mental health support are growing in popularity. They are affordable and accessible, eliminating concerns about treatment costs and long meetings to meet the therapist. Traditional psychotherapy provides support space for clients to slow down and reflect. Some software requires considerable human surveillance, as algorithms are known to send false information.

Equity has been calling for greater protections in the UK with their campaign Stop AI Stealing The Show.

articles.title: AI is the ‘new industrial revolution' for offshore survey

New research from the Canadian Association of Financial Institutions in Insurance (CAFII) and Deloitte underscores the need for the insurance industry to modernize and harness new technologies.

articles.title: AI technology company AdZen inserts subtle ads in chatbot conversations
articles.author: Business Journal
articles.summary: AdZen.ai has built a platform to place advertisements into people's AI bot conversations to place them gently into their conversations.    i.e. to place adverts into their AI bots' conversations, as opposed to directly into their natural conversation.

articles.title: Coalition urges California attorney general to halt OpenAI's for-profit restructuring
articles.author: The Los Angeles Times
articles.summary: A coalition of California nonprofits, foundations and labor groups are raising concerns about ChatGPT maker OpenAI. They want the state attorney general to halt the startup's plans to restructure itself as a for-profit company. More than 50 organizations, led by LatinoProsperity and the San Francisco, want to protect charitable assets.

articles.title: The AI Agent Era Requires a New Kind of Game Theory
articles.author: Wired
articles.summary: Zico Kolter is a Carnegie Mellon professor and a board member at OpenAI. He talks to WIRED about the dangers of AI agents interacting with one another and why models need to be more resistant to attacks. He also talks about the need for AI models to be resistant to attack.

articles.title: This is New Jersey's absolute worst trait, according to AI
articles.author: Jeff Deminski
articles.summary: SportsMillions used artificial intelligence to create a list of the worst features of each state. New Jersey's worst feature is overbearing attitude. Alabama has endless humidity, Arkansas has bugs the size of small pets, Florida has swamps filled with alligators, Maryland has crab cakes everywhere, Utah has strict rules and Wisconsin has excessive cheese consumption.

articles.title: The Center of Excellence invites community and technical college students to their AI Workshop Series
articles.author: Pierce College
articles.summary: The Center of Excellence for Information and Computer Technology invites all Washington community and technical college students to their upcoming AI Workshop Series. Students will learn from industry experts from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta and more and gain hands-on experience with leading AI tools. Workshops occur every Friday at 1 p.m. from April 11 through May 30, 2025.
